body.title: Drones over South Jersey, Northeast were 'not the enemy,' White House says
body.description: White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt delivered a statement from President Donald Trump on Tuesday regarding drone ...
body.article_content:
Two months after mysterious, large drones dominated South Jersey skies and social media feeds, the new administration in the White House has offered an explanation.

According to White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt, the aircraft were authorized by the Federal Aviation Administration. Leavitt delivered a statement from U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday regarding the drones.

"After research and study, the drones that were flying over New Jersey in large numbers were authorized to be flown by the FAA for research and various other reasons," she said on Trump's behalf.

"Many of these drones were also hobbyist, recreational and private individuals that enjoy flying drones ... in time it got worse due to curiosity. This was not the enemy."

The drones were first reported in Morris County the week before Thanksgiving.

Since then, numerous lawmakers and state representatives, including New Jersey Gov. Phil Murphy, urged the federal agencies investigating the drones for transparency.

Until now, the questions surrounding the drone issue largely went unanswered, and the mysterious aircrafts were the topic of conversation and rumors.

In December, U.S. Rep. Jeff Van Drew (R-NJ) called for the aerials to be shot down and pointed a finger at an Iranian mothership as a potential culprit.

On Dec. 18, the Federal Aviation Administration issued temporary flight restrictions over a number of communities, including Camden, Evesham, Westampton, Burlington and more.

The restrictions were implemented for "Special Security Reasons" and were set to last through Jan. 17.

This is a developing story and may be updated.

Kaitlyn McCormick writes about trending issues and community news across South Jersey for the Courier-Post, The Daily Journal and the Burlington County Times. If you have a story she should tell, email her at kmccormick@gannett.com. And subscribe to stay up to date on the news you need.

body.title: Chinese AI app DeepSeek could be bad for stocks but good for local startups
body.description: By some measures, Boston’s startup ecosystem has been left far behind Silicon Valley in the race to develop artificial ...
body.article_content:
The groundbreaking aspect of the otherwise copycat chatbot was that DeepSeek was created without access to the most advanced semiconductors and at a claimed cost of around $5 million, a tiny fraction of the expense of developing rival AI models. In the stock market, shares of Nvidia, the leading maker of AI chips, dropped 17 percent , while other tech stocks also took a hit.

The free-of-charge app, launched last week, showed off conversational chops close to the level of ChatGPT, Claude, and other AI offerings from US companies. (Just don’t ask it questions about Chinese politics .) Over the weekend, DeepSeek rocketed to the most downloaded position in the app stores of Apple and Google.

By some measures, Boston’s startup ecosystem has been left far behind Silicon Valley in the race to develop artificial intelligence. But the shocking emergence of Chinese AI chatbot DeepSeek could actually help Boston catch up.

As Globe tech columnist Hiawatha Bray noted, DeepSeek published a white paper revealing how it developed the model inexpensively, which should help AI researchers all over the world make advancements more quickly.

Advertisement

“DeepSeek is the next piece in the AI arms race,” said computer science professor Elke Rundensteiner at Worcester Polytechnic Institute. “New AI models like DeepSeek are fuel for launching new startups and accelerating existing ones in New England and beyond.”

So far, California has dominated Boston and other regions in raising venture capital backing for AI startups. Out west, most of the money has gone to companies developing underlying tech like ChatGPT developer OpenAI. Boston’s ecosystem has focused on building applications that use AI, or in the case of MIT spinoff Liquid AI, creating its own version of much cheaper AI models.

Venture capitalist Jeff Bussgang at Flybridge Capital Partners sees the plummeting cost of AI as a boon for local startups. “We saw it with cloud computing and we are seeing it now with AI,” Bussgang said. “As a result, we will see an explosion of demand and AI-based apps will benefit tremendously.”

Cheaper AI could also benefit public companies in the area that have been adding AI features. Shares of HubSpot and Klaviyo have gained about 11 percent each so far this week, as the companies have been incorporating AI services into their marketing and customer service software.

Advertisement

But DeepSeek’s low-cost AI tech may not be quite so beneficial for the stock market at large, where seven tech giants each valued at more than $1 trillion dominate market indexes. The fallout could be more severe, and some have drawn parallels to the end of the internet bubble.

From the start of 1995 to March 2000, the Nasdaq Composite Index increased almost 600 percent. Then over the weekend of March 18, 2000, Barrons magazine published a cover story headlined “Burning Up,” which provided evidence that hundreds of dot-com companies would run out of money by year-end.

Within a year, the index had fallen more than 60 percent and didn’t reach 5,000 again for 14 years.

The leaders of the current tech big seven, including Nvidia chief executive Jensen Huang and Apple chief executive Tim Cook, all will address Wall Street analysts in the coming weeks as they report fourth-quarter results. Their responses to the DeepSeek shockwave could make or break the internet bubble analogy.

“This is likely to act as an overhang on the technology and energy sectors until a broad array of company management teams provide their own insight/perspectives during the Q4’24 earnings season,” a team of analysts at Goldman Sachs wrote on Monday.

Aaron Pressman can be reached at aaron.pressman@globe.com. Follow him @ampressman.

body.title: Josh Stewart Answers the Phone in 'Lifeline' Paranormal Thriller Trailer
body.description: "Can we push back this deadline that you've set?" Dark Sky Films has revealed an official trailer for indie thriller Lifeline ...
body.article_content:
Josh Stewart Answers the Phone in 'Lifeline' Paranormal Thriller Trailer

"Can we push back this deadline that you've set?" Dark Sky Films has revealed an official trailer for indie thriller Lifeline, from director Feras Alfuqaha. Yet another hotline thriller focusing on a person answering a phone - this night he receives an odd, paranormal call. There have been a few of these recently - including The Guilty with Jake Gyllenhaal or Tessa Thompson's The Listener. In Lifeline, a suicide hotline operator gets a late-night call from someone who claims to be him, knowing private details only he would know, and threatening to end his life in an hour. The operator must race against time to stop "himself" from suicide. Josh Stewart stars as Steven Thomas, along with August Maturo, Charlene Amoia, Jocelyn Ayanna, Nicole Santiago, Jill Awbrey, & Brecken Merrill. This also reminds me of the film Frequency (2000) about a father and son connecting across time through the phone. Lifeline looks much better than it sounds.

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Feras Alfuqaha's film Lifeline, direct from YouTube:

A late-night suicide hotline operator named Steven Thomas (starring Josh Stewart) receives a disturbing call from someone claiming to be him, knowing personal details only he would know. The caller threatens to end his life within the hour, forcing the operator into a tense, emotional race against time. As the clock ticks down, he must confront his deepest fears and uncover the truth before it's too late to save "himself." Lifeline is directed by the indie producer / filmmaker Feras Alfuqaha, now making his feature directorial debut after producing a number of other projects as well. The screenplay is written by Brady Morell and Brian Price. Produced by Feras Alfuqaha and Leal Naim. Dark Sky Films will debut Alfuqaha's Lifeline film in select US theaters + on VOD starting on February 21st, 2025 coming soon. Who wants to watch this?

body.title: Ghost Adventures couple Mark and Debby Constantino's tragic ending revisited
body.description: What happened to Ghost Adventures couple Mark and Debby Constantino? Learn interesting details about the two Travel Channel's ...
body.article_content:
The world of paranormal investigation took a dark turn when the lives of Mark and Debby Constantino, beloved figures from the Travel Channel's Ghost Adventures, ended in a tragic and violent episode. Known for their expertise in electronic voice phenomena (EVP), the Constantinos brought a unique blend of humour and skill to the show, making them fan favourites. However, beneath their on-screen chemistry lay a troubled relationship marked by domestic strife.

Ghost Adventures stars. Photo: @GhostAdventures (modified by author)

Source: Twitter

Mark and Debby Constantino were notable figures in the paranormal investigation community, particularly recognised for their Electronic Voice Phenomena (EVP) expertise. They gained fame by appearing on the Travel Channel's popular series Ghost Adventures, where they contributed to various episodes by capturing purported ghostly voices and sounds.

What happened to the Constantino couple?

On a quiet September morning in 2015, in the eerie silence of Sparks, Nevada, the news of the Ghost Adventures couple found dead in Nevada broke out. The couple (Mark and Debby Constantino) had a darker side to their story.

Their journey from paranormal enthusiasts to tragic figures unfolded with a backdrop of domestic violence and legal battles, culminating in an event that left the paranormal community and fans of the show in disbelief and mourning.

Background and rise to fame

Mark and Debby Constantino were initially celebrated for their work in electronic voice phenomena (EVP), a method used in paranormal research to capture the voices of spirits on recording devices. They appeared on Ghost Adventures, where they helped analyse audio evidence for signs of ghostly communication.

Their work was not only a part of the show's appeal but also contributed significantly to the field of paranormal investigation, making them beloved figures in this niche community. Their dynamic, often seen as playful banter on the show, made their appearances memorable. However, there were signs of a troubled relationship behind this public persona.

Domestic strife and public records

The Constantinos' relationship had a history of domestic violence, which became public knowledge through several court documents and police reports.

2012 incident

Mark filed for a temporary restraining order against Debby, claiming he feared she might stab him while intoxicated. He withdrew the request the following day, but this incident was the first public hint of their domestic issues.

August 2015

A more severe incident led to Mark being charged with kidnapping, domestic battery by strang, and domestic battery. That stemmed from an altercation where Mark allegedly dragged Debby from a car, leading to her filing for divorce and seeking a protective order. Their daughter, Raquel, was also implicated in this incident.

10 September 2015

Debby filed for divorce from Mark, citing his control over their finances and alleging that he was "bleeding the accounts dry." She sought spousal support and the return of their business, which she claimed to have created.

The Constantinos had a long history of domestic abuse allegations against each other, including multiple restraining orders filed over the years. Debby had previously accused Mark of severe physical abuse, claiming he had beaten and strangled her during confrontations.

In one instance, she described being dragged from her car and assaulted until police officers intervened. Mark and Debby's history of violence was well-documented in court records and was known to local law enforcement. Both had filed protective orders against each other at various times, indicating a deeply troubled relationship that escalated over time.

These events painted a starkly different picture from their on-screen camaraderie, revealing a relationship fraught with violence and legal battles.

The final days

The events leading to their deaths unfolded tragically on 22 September 2015. They include:

22 September 2015

The day of the incident began with a disturbing discovery. Debby's roommate found James Anderson, a third roommate, dead from a gunshot wound in their shared apartment. Concerned for Debby's safety, the roommate contacted the police, fearing she might also be in danger.

The morning of 22 September

Police tracked Debby's mobile phone to an apartment rented by their daughter, where Mark was staying. When officers knocked on the door around 11:15 AM, they heard shots fired from inside. Mark shouted that he had Debby and demanded time to "gather his thoughts," threatening her life if his demands were not met.

The police attempted to negotiate with Mark for several hours. However, communication ceased after a certain point, leading authorities to breach the door using explosives.

Discovery of bodies

Upon entering, police found both Mark and Debby deceased from gunshot wounds. Mark had shot Debby twice before turning the gun on himself. The investigation revealed that Mark had also been involved in the earlier murder of James Anderson.

Impact on the Paranormal Community

Ghost Adventures couple Mark and Debby Constantino pose for the camera. Photo: @GhostAdventures

Source: Twitter

The paranormal community and Ghost Adventures fans were left in shock and mourning. The show's cast and crew expressed profound sadness and confusion over the incident, with Zak Bagans, the host, tweeting that it was a "very tragic dark day."

The event sparked discussions about the emotional toll of dealing with the paranormal, possibly exacerbating underlying personal issues.

Aftermath

The immediate aftermath included tributes from fans and peers, some of whom speculated on the influence of their paranormal activities on their personal lives, though these theories remain unsubstantiated.

There was a notable episode of Ghost Adventures where the crew attempted to contact Zak Bagan's friends who passed away, Mark and Debby, which was met with mixed reactions regarding the ethics of such an investigation.

Despite their deaths, Debby and Mark left a legacy in the paranormal community through their contributions to EVP and the cautionary tale of their personal lives. Their story has since been a topic of discussion in forums and among paranormal enthusiasts, often as a lesson on the importance of mental health and the dangers of domestic violence.

FAQs about Mark and Debby Constantino

What happened to Debby Constantino from Ghost Adventures? Debby Constantino was found dead alongside her estranged husband, Mark, in September 2015. How did the third roommate get involved in the Mark and Debby Constantino situation? James Anderson lived with Debby and Mark Constantino in their shared apartment, and their relationship with them was typical of a roommate arrangement. What happened to Debby and Mark Constantino's child? Debby and Mark Constantino's daughter was involved in various violent incidents with her parents before their tragic death in September 2015. What happened to Raquel Constantino after the incident? After the tragic death of her parents, Raquel Constantino pleaded guilty to a battery charge related to previous assaults involving her parents and received a suspended sentence, contingent on completing anger management and alcohol counselling. How long were Debby and Mark Constantino married? Debby and Mark Constantino were married for approximately 27 years before their separation and subsequent divorce filing in September 2015. Why did Debby and Mark Constantino divorce? The main reasons for Debby and Mark Constantino's divorce included lack of commitment, infidelity, and too much conflict in their relationship. Did they cancel Ghost Adventures after Debby and Mark Constantino died? No. Ghost Adventures has continued to air and produce new content after Debby and Mark Constantino died.

Wrapping up

On 22 September 2015, Mark and Debby Constantino, known for their appearances on Ghost Adventures, were found dead in an apartment in Sparks, Nevada, following a police standoff. Mark shot Debby before taking his life. Their history was marred by numerous incidents of domestic abuse, with both parties having filed restraining orders against each other in the years leading up to their deaths.

Tuko.co.ke also shared an article about When Evil Lurks ending. When Evil Lurks, scripted and directed by Demian Rugna, premiered on September 16, 2023. The supernatural horror film stars Marcelo Michinaux, Silvia Sabater, Luis Ziembrowski, and Demian Salomon.

Understanding its ending will transform how you view this chilling film. Discover When Evil Lurks ending to help you unravel Pedro and Jaime's fates and clarify the complex plot twists that make the movie so compelling in this article.

Source: TUKO.co.ke

body.title: Is the ‘Conjuring House’ for sale again? Here’s what to know.
body.description: The supposedly haunted Rhode Island farmhouse has been closed for business after town officials did not renew its license ...
body.article_content:
But the business continued to operate, and Nuñez and a general manager were issued citations in December .

The decision by the Burrillville Town Council followed months of controversies surrounding the historic property made famous by “The Conjuring” movie franchise and its owner, Jacqueline Nuñez, including allegations from former employees that Nuñez owed them money.

Since then, there have been “no signs of activity” at the house, Burrillville police Chief Stephen Lynch confirmed to the Globe on Monday.

Speculation over the future of the property sparked again last week after Burrillville Town Manager Michael C. Wood told The Providence Journal a YouTuber named Elton Castee asked him earlier this month what would be required to reopen the house to the public if he and comedian Matt Rife were able to purchase the property.

Get Rhode Map A weekday briefing from veteran Rhode Island reporters, focused on the things that matter most in the Ocean State. Enter Email Sign Up

In September, Castee wrote in a post on X that he and Rife were “ready and willing to buy” the home if Nuñez was “keen to sell.”

Advertisement

Wood, who did not respond to inquiries from the Globe on Monday, told the The Journal the property needs a fire alarm and upgrades to its sprinkler system, among other things.

“We still want it to be a successful venture,” Wood told the newspaper. “We’d like to hear from Jacqueline and have some resolution to it. I think there’s a win-win out there.”

Neither Castee nor Rife could be reached for comment on Monday.



Nuñez: ‘I have heard nothing’

In a text message to the Globe, Nuñez wrote she had not heard from either Rife or Castee. She did not answer a question about whether she would consider selling the house or if she has plans to reopen it herself.

“I have heard nothing. I fear for my safety,” Nuñez wrote. “I have had kidnapping threats from Burrillville people if I set foot on the Conjuring House property.”

Advertisement

Lynch, in an email, wrote police are “not aware of any threats” to Nuñez.

According to the The Conjuring House website, the business is listed as closed until further notice, and it states that an update will be given on a reopening “as soon as we know it.”

“TCH will open for business again,” the website states. “Our stateside and worldwide following is extensive and you, our guests, deserve access to the most famous paranormal location in the world!”

The website also states Nuñez plans to file several lawsuits, including one against the Town of Burrillville for the “arbitrary and capricious non-renewal of the TCH Business License in violation of Constitutional and Administrative State, Federal and International Laws.”

Nuñez has had other issues with town officials, as well, outside of The Conjuring House. In October, she was arrested by police after she allegedly led officers on a chase through town while driving under the influence. She has denied the accusations.

Who else has owned the Conjuring House?

Also known as the Old Arnold estate, the property was previously home to eight generations of the Arnold family since 1736.

The house’s infamous backstory came in the 1970s when paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren conducted a seance in 1973 in an attempt to rid the home of spirits said to be tormenting the Perron family, who was living there at the time.

In later years, Norma Sutcliff lived in the house for more than three decades before she sold the home in 2019.

After the release of the 2013 film, “The Conjuring,” Sutcliff, who has disputed notions of any haunted or otherworldly phenomenon at the home, said she was subjected to constant harassment by thrill-seekers and horror fans who wanted to lay their eyes on the storied property.

Advertisement

“Ever since the movie came out, we’ve been harassed, trespassed, stalked, and besieged,” Sutcliff told the Globe in 2015. “They come at all times of the day. Last Saturday, I called police at 3:30 a.m. because there was a whole group of them outside the house. It’s horrendous.”

Sutcliff ultimately sold the property in 2019 to Cory and Jennifer Heinzen, two paranormal investigators from Maine who had a vision to restore the home and open it up to the curious public.

“We immediately fell in love with it,” Heinzen told The Sun Journal at the time. “Eight-and-a-half acres, a river in the back and a pond, it’s so serene down there, never mind the story behind the house, it’s a beautiful home.”

The couple later sold the place to Nuñez, who purchased it in 2022, paying about $1.525 million, and pledged to keep the business going.

“I know I have big shoes to fill, and I intend to do it,” she said at the time.

Christopher Gavin can be reached at christopher.gavin@globe.com.

body.title: Breakthrough as NASA discovers planet 6 times as big as Earth that could be habitable
body.description: Scientists have confirmed the discovery of a new planet which is six times as large as the Earth and could host alien life.
body.article_content:
Researchers discover planet that is six times as big as Earth

Scientists have confirmed the discovery of a new planet which is six times as large as the Earth and could host alien life. The new planet, with a mass six times that of Earth's, orbits a star similar to our Sun. It has been named HD 20794 d and confirmed by an international team of scientists. It was originally found two years ago by Dr Michael Cretignier from Oxford University's physics department and is located in the Eridanus constellation. Dr Cretignier explained: "With its location in a habitable zone and relatively close proximity to Earth, this planet could play a pivotal role in future missions that will characterise the atmospheres of exoplanets to search for biosignatures indicating potential life." He first identified the potential exoplanet signal in 2022 while studying archive data recorded by the HARPS (High Accuracy Radial Velocity Planet Searcher) spectrograph at the La Silla Observatory in Chile. Such data analyses light absorbed and emitted by objects.

READ MORE NASA breakthrough as experts discover there may be life on Uranus moons

The new planet has a mass six times that of Earth

The expert spotted periodic shifts in the spectrum of light emitted by the host star, which Oxford University said could have been caused by a nearby planet's gravitational pull. At the time of Dr Cretignier's initial discovery, it was unclear if the signal was caused by a planet, the star or if it was just a technical glitch. Members from the international team of scientists studied "highly-precise" measurements taken over 20 years by HARPS and the Echelle SPectrograph for Rocky Exoplanet and Stable Spectroscopic Observations (ESPRESSO). The two instruments are among the most advanced in the world for measuring tiny variations in light. Detailed in a new study published in Astronomy & Astrophysics, the discovery also relied on data from NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS). Dr Cretignier said scientists worked on the data for years, analysing and eliminating possible sources of contamination to pinpoint the planet's signal. The discovery was confirmed after the results from HARPS and ESPRESSO were combined.

The new planet was originally found two years ago (file image)

body.title: Life sciences investor commits $130M to UChicago drug discovery
body.description: After striking similar deals with Northwestern and UIC, Deerfield Management aims to help the University of Chicago turn more ...
body.article_content:
A large life-science investor is committing up to $130 million over the next 10 years to help the University of Chicago turn more of its research into successful drugs and other treatments.

New York-based Deerfield Management has similar partnerships with 30 universities across the country, including Northwestern University, the University of Illinois at Chicago and the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. The firm’s goal is to work with scientists early and help them commercialize their research more quickly by providing expertise and funding.

“Deerfield is in that missing middle: funding initiatives which cannot be conducted under NIH or NSF funding but are too early stage for angel or venture funding,” says Samir Mayekar, associate vice president and managing director of UChicago's Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation. "That’s the hardest money to get.”

The partnership with Deerfield is the latest move by UChicago to step up its game in technology transfer, or commercializing research and creating startup companies. It was a key goal of former President Bob Zimmer, and the effort is picking up under his successor, Paul Alivisatos, a materials-science researcher who has founded several startups.

UChicago launched a deep-technology incubator and created several venture capital funds to help faculty, staff and students launch new companies. The most recent is UCM Ventures, a $25 million fund focused on healthcare startups.

UChicago also will have space for researchers and a life-sciences incubator in a new 14-story office and lab facility called Hyde Park Labs, which is expected welcome its first tenants soon.

Bill Slattery, a partner at Deerfield, praised the university for its "spirit of entrepreneurship that doesn’t abandon the principles of education, which is a tough line to walk. This is a moment in time for U of C to seize that."

Deerfield Management and UChicago are calling their partnership Hyde Park Discovery. A committee made up of leadership from the university, the Polsky Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation, and Deerfield’s scientific team will evaluate projects.

"Drug discovery takes time and is expensive," Slattery says, adding that Deerfield has made roughly a dozen investments so far at UIC, Northwestern and UIUC.

body.title: State of Java Survey Confirms Majority of Enterprise Apps Are Built on Java
body.description: State of Java Survey & Report shows that the shift away from Oracle Java continues based on Oracle's employee-based pricing.
body.article_content:
82% of companies are fed up with Oracle pricing

Java turns 30 years old in 2025. What better time to release the 2025 State of Java Survey and Report? Our second annual survey serves as a guide to understanding Java adoption and trends, and confirms Java’s impact on application performance, developer productivity, and AI development. More than ever before, Java continues to lead in innovation, adaptability, and performance.

Welcome to Azul’s 2025 State of Java Survey & Report, a study of more than 2,000 Java professionals worldwide. The report uncovers how enterprises are tackling Oracle Java pricing and licensing challenges, strategies for addressing cloud costs, factors impacting DevOps productivity, and the role of Java in AI development.



Let’s look at some of the important results and trends from the 2025 State of Java Survey & Report.

Java’s continuing influence in the enterprise

Java remains a cornerstone for enterprise application development. Only 1% of those contacted to participate in the survey were disqualified because they don’t use Java. In addition, nearly 70% of respondents say that more than half of their applications are built with Java or run on a JVM.

19% of participants use Java 6 or 7, two of the oldest versions still in production (remember Java 6 was originally released in 2006!), and 49% use Java 17 or 21, the two newest Long-Term Support (LTS) versions. The results underscore Java’s role for both maintaining legacy applications and systems and for running modern, scalable applications and architectures.

More than just a programming language and a force for technical stability, Java is a critical enabler of enterprise innovation in areas such as artificial intelligence (more on that later).

The Great Oracle Java Migration gains momentum

Two years after Oracle introduced its employee-based pricing for Oracle Java SE in January 2023, organizations continue to grapple with Oracle’s employee-based pricing model. 82% of Oracle Java users express concern over its cost structure — a figure unchanged since Azul’s 2023 survey. Oracle Java users are turning their displeasure into action and joining The Great Oracle Java Migration. 88% of Oracle Java users are considering a switch to another Java provider. Nearly half of these companies plan to migrate to an OpenJDK distribution with paid support, preferring a cost-effective yet reliable solution.

88% of Oracle Java users are considering a switch to another Java provider.

As organizations recognize the value of paid support, they are considering switching Java providers for two main reasons – cost and experience.

Overall, 79% of Oracle Java users who are considering migrating to another distribution cited Oracle as a reason. In fact, seven of the top eight responses were about Oracle, and four of them were about Oracle’s behavior and the experience of being a customer (including sales tactics, pricing uncertainty, and audits). These responses underscore that organizations increasingly seek cost-effective, flexible, and transparent alternatives to Oracle Java to mitigate financial and operational risks.

_________________________________________________________________________________________

7 of the top 8 reasons for migrating from Oracle Java to an OpenJDK distribution were about Oracle pricing or support, or the experience of being an Oracle Java customer.

_____________________________________________________________________________________

Azul Platform Core customers typically pay 70% less than Oracle for licensing fees and support. They also have commercial support available for Java 6 and 7, which they can’t get from any other distribution, and Azul is the only Java provider besides Oracle that delivers stabilized security builds. Azul also delivers full updates every quarter that combine bug fixes, new features, and security patches.

Organizations tackle cloud costs, but overages are still high

As organizations increase their public cloud footprint, they are dedicating more than half of their cloud capacity to Java workloads. In a clear sign of inefficient resource allocation, most participants in this survey have more than 20% of their cloud compute capacity sitting idle. Overprovisioning not only inflates operating costs but also diverts funds that they could invest in innovation or growth initiatives.

Optimizing Java in the cloud presents a substantial opportunity to reduce costs without compromising performance. Organizations are taking steps to better align their cloud investments with actual usage. They are making behavioral changes like implementing internal rules and establishing DevOps functions. They are also using more efficient processors and autoscaling their workloads. In addition, a quarter of participants are using a high-performance Java runtime to improve application performance, optimize cloud compute costs, and improve customer experiences.

Organizations are leveraging many different approaches to curb cloud spend, including utilizing a high-performance JDK.

Azul Platform Prime is an enhanced build of OpenJDK, with additional features for faster and more consistent steady-state performance, faster startup and warmup, and more efficient use of resources. Azul Prime customers enjoy better performance and lower cloud and infrastructure costs.

Code management and security impact DevOps productivity

The survey reveals significant challenges to application development productivity. Organizations must remove efficiency barriers to development if they are to bring new features to their customers faster. Dead or unused code is a major challenge, and 62% of survey participants report that it affects their DevOps teams’ effectiveness.

A third of participants say their DevOps teams waste more than half their time addressing false positives from Java-related security vulnerabilities. 41% report that they encounter critical production security issues within their Java ecosystem on a weekly or daily basis. The high frequency of false positives can become overwhelming, leading to alert fatigue and reducing employees’ attentiveness to genuine security threats.

False positives prevent efficient vulnerability triage.

When DevOps can’t separate the real vulnerabilities from the plethora of alerts, notifications, and sometimes even spam, they have to siphon resources away from development and other priorities. But they must remain vigilant. Half of companies still report finding vulnerable versions of the Log4j library in production, more than two years after a patch was made available.

Azul Intelligence Cloud has two unique capabilities to help with DevOps productivity. Azul Code Inventory catalogs what code runs in production across an enterprise’s Java workloads. It slashes the time and burden of identifying dead and unused code, allowing developers to focus on the code that actually matters (and over time prune the code that doesn’t). Azul Vulnerability Detection detects vulnerable code that is actually run in production (versus simply present in the jar or container), eliminating false positives to enable rapid and efficient vulnerability triage.

Java powers enterprise AI development

Typically, when the topic of developing AI or ML functionality arises, people think of Python. Perhaps surprisingly, the survey found that Java was used more often than either Python or other languages. In fact, 50% of organizations use Java to code AI functionality.

50% of companies that build AI functionality build it with Java.

AI impacts the way organizations strategize, build code, and maintain applications and infrastructure. As you might expect, this AI adoption comes with infrastructure implications, and 72% of survey participants say their compute capacity will have to grow for them to support Java applications with AI functionality.

State of Java Survey & Report is available now

This report shows organizations are actively seeking ways to optimize their Java deployments to drive operational efficiency and cost predictability. As Java continues to be the backbone for business-critical applications in the enterprise, we’re seeing important trends — from the growing interest in Oracle Java alternatives to cloud optimization strategies, improvements in DevOps productivity, and innovation with AI. Read Azul’s full 2025 State of Java Survey & Report today.

body.title: Breakthrough as NASA discovers planet 6 times as big as Earth that could be habitable
body.description: Scientists have confirmed the discovery of a new planet which is six times as large as the Earth and could host alien life.
body.article_content:
Researchers discover planet that is six times as big as Earth

Scientists have confirmed the discovery of a new planet which is six times as large as the Earth and could host alien life. The new planet, with a mass six times that of Earth's, orbits a star similar to our Sun. It has been named HD 20794 d and confirmed by an international team of scientists. It was originally found two years ago by Dr Michael Cretignier from Oxford University's physics department and is located in the Eridanus constellation. Dr Cretignier explained: "With its location in a habitable zone and relatively close proximity to Earth, this planet could play a pivotal role in future missions that will characterise the atmospheres of exoplanets to search for biosignatures indicating potential life." He first identified the potential exoplanet signal in 2022 while studying archive data recorded by the HARPS (High Accuracy Radial Velocity Planet Searcher) spectrograph at the La Silla Observatory in Chile. Such data analyses light absorbed and emitted by objects.

READ MORE NASA breakthrough as experts discover there may be life on Uranus moons

The new planet has a mass six times that of Earth

The expert spotted periodic shifts in the spectrum of light emitted by the host star, which Oxford University said could have been caused by a nearby planet's gravitational pull. At the time of Dr Cretignier's initial discovery, it was unclear if the signal was caused by a planet, the star or if it was just a technical glitch. Members from the international team of scientists studied "highly-precise" measurements taken over 20 years by HARPS and the Echelle SPectrograph for Rocky Exoplanet and Stable Spectroscopic Observations (ESPRESSO). The two instruments are among the most advanced in the world for measuring tiny variations in light. Detailed in a new study published in Astronomy & Astrophysics, the discovery also relied on data from NASA's Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS). Dr Cretignier said scientists worked on the data for years, analysing and eliminating possible sources of contamination to pinpoint the planet's signal. The discovery was confirmed after the results from HARPS and ESPRESSO were combined.

The new planet was originally found two years ago (file image)

body.title: Ice Open Network Launches Mainnet with 200 Validators
body.description: Ice Open Network (ION) is the blueprint for a new Internet rooted in privacy, data ownership, and user autonomy. Powered by a ...
body.article_content:
ROAD TOWN, British Virgin Islands, Jan. 29, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Ice Open Network (ION), a high-performance, privacy-focused Layer-1 blockchain, today announced its official mainnet launch after reaching a 200 validator headcount. This milestone follows an extensive development and testing phase, accompanied by significant ecosystem expansion, which saw ION amass a 40-million community. Crucially, it paves the way for ION’s hotly anticipated social media platform and decentralized application (dApp) builder.

“This is a testament to the strength and conviction of our community,” said Alexandru Iulian Florea, Founder and CEO of Ice Open Network. “We initially aimed for 100 validators at launch – to see that number double underscores the trust and enthusiasm surrounding ION. It’s a resounding vote of confidence in our vision to redefine the Internet through decentralization.”

ION’s unique architecture allows it to scale horizontally as its network participants increase, with the capacity to accommodate billions of users without compromising their privacy and security, nor the chain’s ability to process millions of transactions per second. Combining efficiency with a human-first approach, the ION framework is designed to decentralize and secure the core elements of digital interaction – user identity, content storage and delivery, and social engagement. The result is a robust, yet highly versatile dApp infrastructure with real-world utility, purpose-built to bring the Internet’s 5.5 billion users on-chain.

Following the mainnet launch is the arrival of Online+ – an integrated social media dApp showcasing the blockchain’s capabilities that serves both as a hub for ION’s community, and a blueprint for dApp developers wishing to build on ION’s framework. Ice Open Network’s flagship no-code, drag-and-drop dApp-building tool, which will allow anyone, regardless of technical expertise, to create decentralized applications on ION from scratch, is next in line and due for release in 2025.

The ION blockchain mainnet rollout began in November 2024, and is accompanied by the deployment of the ION Bridge, which enables the migration of the network’s native ICE coin from Binance Smart Chain (BSC) to the ION blockchain. Currently, the network’s 200 validators have staked over 15% of the 6.8 billion ICE in circulation – a percentage set to increase as Online+ goes live.

About Ice Open Network

Ice Open Network (ION) is the blueprint for a new Internet rooted in privacy, data ownership, and user autonomy. Powered by a high-performance Layer-1 blockchain and an unwavering commitment to digital sovereignty, it is designed to give decentralized applications (dApps) real-world, human-centric utility at unprecedented breadth and scale.

Founded in 2022, ION serves a dApp ecosystem of over 40 million users. It is engineered to process millions of transactions per second and scale horizontally and infinitely as its network participants increase. Combining this unparalleled efficiency with a comprehensive dApp toolkit purpose-built for intuitive, privacy-preserving user experiences, ION is on a mission to onboard the world to a new, decentralized Internet.

For more information, please visit https://ice.io

body.title: Lebanon Faces a Colossal Disposal Task: Clearing War Debris
body.description: The conflict between Israel and Hezbollah has left behind lots of rubble. Some experts fear that much of it will be dumped ...
body.article_content:
For the past three months, Ahmad Mehdi has been living in half a home. In October, an Israeli airstrike on the building next to his in a neighborhood south of Beirut blew out most of the kitchen and living room of his fifth-floor apartment.

When he looks at what remains of the building next door, he is overwhelmed by the scale of destruction. “Eleven floors worth of rubble have collapsed into two,” he said. “All you see are rocks and dirt and steel and bits of iron.”

Like many Lebanese whose homes and businesses suffered damage during more than a year of war between Israel and Hezbollah, Mr. Mehdi, 20, and his family are eager to start repairs, but they cannot do much until the rubble is cleared. “That is our biggest problem: Where do we put the debris?” he said.

As Lebanon starts the slow process of rebuilding after a tenuous cease-fire between Hezbollah, the Iran-backed Lebanese militant group, and Israel, it is struggling to figure out how to clean up the vast amounts of rubble left scattered around Beirut, the capital. A report from the National Council for Scientific Research in Lebanon said a preliminary estimate of damages showed that nearly 3,000 buildings in the Dahiya area south of the city had been destroyed, severely damaged or extensively damaged.

body.title: US tech stocks plunge on China AI's unexpectedly strong showing
body.description: The US markets got a loud wake-up call on Monday when shares of major US artificial intelligence and semiconductor companies ...
body.article_content:
The US markets got a loud wake-up call on Monday when shares of major US artificial intelligence and semiconductor companies slumped on a wave of fear that Chinese companies were poised to surpass them in the high-stakes battle for supremacy.

Analysts were divided on whether the panic selling and sentiment behind it were an overreaction or an indication that Silicon Valley had underestimated Chinese tech prowess and its ability to circumvent America's many export bans and restrictions.

The catalyst was Chinese AI start-up DeepSeek's strong showing over the weekend when it overtook OpenAI's ChatGPT as the most-downloaded free app in the US on Apple's App Store.

Do you have questions about the biggest topics and trends from around the world? Get the answers with SCMP Knowledge, our new platform of curated content with explainers, FAQs, analyses and infographics brought to you by our award-winning team.

American semiconductor giant Nvidia's stock price, for instance, was down as much as 25 per cent on Monday before closing at US$118.58, down 16.8 per cent, erasing hundreds of billions of US dollars in market value.

Broadcom, Micron Tech, Oracle, Microsoft and Alphabet, Google's parent company, were among the tech firms also seeing losses in Monday trading.

The shock registered more broadly, with the tech-heavy Nasdaq Composite Index down throughout the trading day, closing at 19,341.8, down 3.07 per cent, while the S&P 500 was off 1.46 per cent.

Some analysts say Investor excess could be at play in the tech-heavy Nasdaq's dip. Photo: Getty Images via AFP alt=Some analysts say Investor excess could be at play in the tech-heavy Nasdaq's dip. Photo: Getty Images via AFP>

But the Dow Jones Industrial Average managed a small gain, posting a 0.65 per cent increase.

DeepSeek's AI reasoning model R1 was published fully open-source last week, suggesting it had overcome US sanctions and export controls meant to hinder Chinese tech progress. The company said its latest AI model required less than US$6 million worth of Nvidia's less advanced H800 chips.

Charu Chanana of Saxo Bank wrote in a research note on Monday that DeepSeek "serves as a reminder that competition in the global AI arena is intensifying and Nvidia may not be in the pole position forever".

The developments "could have major implications for both US policy and investor sentiment towards Chinese tech," added Chanana.

"If companies like DeepSeek can innovate despite sanctions, the narrative around China's technological dependence on the US may shift dramatically."

Story Continues

body.title: US economic losses from natural disasters soared in 2024, even as they eased globally
body.description: By ALEX VEIGA AP Business Writer Economic losses from hurricanes and other natural disasters soared in the U.S. last year and were above average globally, reflecting another year of costly severe ...
body.article_content:
By ALEX VEIGA AP Business Writer

Economic losses from hurricanes and other natural disasters soared in the U.S. last year and were above average globally, reflecting another year of costly severe storms, floods and droughts.

Damage caused by Hurricanes Helene and Milton helped push total economic losses from natural disasters in the U.S. to $217.8 billion last year, according to insurance broker Aon PLC. That figure represents an 85.3% increase from 2023, when losses totaled about $117.5 billion. It's also the largest annual tally of economic losses from natural disasters since 2017.

Insured losses, or the portion of economic losses that are covered by insurance, also rose last year. They climbed 36% to $112.7 billion, the most since 2022.

Hurricane Helene tore across six southeastern states last fall, costing $75 billion in economic losses, mainly due to inland and coastal flooding. according to Aon. Less than two weeks later, Hurricane Milton made landfall on the west coast of Florida, causing some $25 billion in economic losses.

"In 2024, one of the big differences is we had significant U.S. hurricane events that happened," said Liz Henderson, global head of climate risk advisory at Aon. "When those events happen, they affect a large area and they affect areas with large values in terms of properties and people and content. So the losses from those events tend to be significantly higher."

At least two other hurricanes, several severe "convective" storms and a draught contributed to the losses from natural disasters in the U.S. last year.

In addition to the severe storms in the U.S., deadly floods in the Valencia region of Spain and other natural disasters drove worldwide economic losses from natural disasters to $368 billion last year, according to Aon. That's a 7.3% decline from 2023, but about 14% higher than the annual average going back to 2000. Global insured losses, meanwhile, climbed 15.1% to $145 billion.

While it's impossible to predict the timing, location and losses from natural disasters, 2025 is not off to an encouraging start. The devastating wildfires that erupted in Los Angeles County on Jan. 7, killing at least 28 people and destroying more than 14,000 structures, are already projected to be among the costliest natural disasters.

In a separate report last week, Aon estimated that total economic and insured losses for the two largest wildfires — the Palisades fire and the Eaton blaze burning just outside Los Angeles — could reach into the lower tens of billions of dollars, likely making them the costliest wildfires in U.S. history.

body.description: If your computer freezes when shutting down or restarting Windows 11/10, this detailed guide will help you troubleshoot and ...
body.article_content:
This article lists some suggestions if your computer freezes when shutting down or restarting Windows 11/10. According to reports, the computer becomes unresponsive when users try to restart or shut it down. The temporary fix to this problem is to force shut down the PC.

Computer freezes when shutting down or restarting Windows 11/10

Use the following fixes if your computer freezes when shutting down or restarting Windows 11/10:

Disconnect all peripherals Run Power Troubleshooter Restore power plan settings to default Check the status of drivers in the Device Manager Repair the system image files Test your RAM Check your hard disk for errors Try to identify Services that are creating issues Update BIOS and chipset driver Troubleshoot in a Clean Boot state.

All these fixes are explained below in detail:

1] Disconnect all peripherals

The first step is to disconnect all peripherals. If your computer does not hang after disconnecting the peripherals, one of them might be responsible for this issue. In this case, updating or reinstalling the required drivers can help.

2] Run Power Troubleshooter

The Power Troubleshooter fixes power-related issues, so running it can be helpful in this case.

3] Restore power plan settings to default

You can also try to reset your power plan settings to the default. Follow the steps provided below:

Open the Control Panel. Type power in the Control Panel search bar and click on the Power Options. Click on the Change plan settings link next to the active power plan. Click Restore default settings for this plan.

4] Check the status of drivers in the Device Manager

Corrupt drivers can be the cause of this issue. Therefore, we suggest you check the status of drivers in the Device Manager. Follow the steps provided below:

Open the Device Manager. Expand all the branches one by one. If any driver shows a yellow exclamation mark, it is faulty. Right-click on that driver and select Properties. You will see the error code and message under the General tab of the driver properties.

Now, troubleshoot according to the Device Manager error code displayed. The Network adapter can also be responsible for this issue. Download the latest version of the network card driver from the official website of your computer’s manufacturer. Now, uninstall the Network driver and install its latest version.

5] Repair the system image files

One possible cause of this issue is the corrupt system image files. Scan your system for system file corruption and repair it with System File Checker and DISM tools.

6] Test your RAM

Your RAM might be faulty. Windows 11 has a built-in tool to test the RAM. Use the Memory Diagnostic Tool to test your RAM. A faulty memory shows some symptoms. Also, notice if your PC is showing these symptoms.

7] Check your hard disk for errors

Hard disk errors cause several issues on a Windows computer. This can be the case with you. Windows 11 has a built-in utility that checks hard drives for errors. Use the Chkdsk utility to scan your C drive for file system errors and bad sectors. If the Check Disk utility finds any errors on your hard disk, it will fix them.

8] Try to identify Services that are creating issues

This post will show you how to identify Windows Services delaying Shutdown or Startup.

9] Update BIOS and chipset driver

Check for BIOS updates. Visit the official website of your computer manufacturer and download the latest version of the BIOS (if available). Install the latest BIOS update. You can view the current version of BIOS in System Information. Your computer should be connected to a power supply during the BIOS update. Make sure that the power supply is not interrupted during the update. If you are a laptop user, connect the charger and turn on the supply even if it is fully charged.

Also, update the chipset driver to the latest version. You can download the same from the official website of your computer manufacturer.

10] Troubleshoot in a Clean Boot state

Perform Clean Boot. Clean-boot troubleshooting is designed to isolate a performance problem. To perform clean-boot troubleshooting, you must take several actions and then restart the computer after each action. You may need to manually disable one item after another to try and pinpoint the one causing the problem. Once you have identified the offender, you can consider removing or disabling it.

I am sure something here will help you.

Read: Windows PC will not Shutdown or Restart

Why does my computer randomly freeze and need to be restarted in Windows 11?

There can be many reasons why your computer freezes randomly, like less RAM, less space on the hard drive, corrupted drivers, overheating issues, etc. Run a RAM test to know whether your RAM is faulty. Also, scan your hard disk for logical errors and bad sectors.

How to boot in Safe Mode?

You can use the MSConfig app to boot in Safe Mode. If you want to use the internet in Safe Mode, boot in Safe Mode with Networking. If you cannot boot into Windows, you can use Windows Recovery Environment to boot into Safe Mode.

Read next: You don’t have permission to shut down and restart this computer.

body.description: The innovative architectural framework developed by Vaibhav Vudayagiri marks a significant milestone in cloud computing ...
body.article_content:
In this modern era, pioneering innovations from principal architect Vaibhav Vudayagiri reveal a transformative approach to scaling AI systems in cloud environments. His innovative methodology, developed at a leading tech firm, demonstrates remarkable advancements in both performance optimization and operational efficiency.

The Next Generation of Cloud Architecture

The innovative architectural framework revolutionizes AI deployment through advanced microservices patterns, enabling seamless cloud infrastructure scaling. By breaking down complex AI systems into modular, independently scalable components, organizations achieve remarkable efficiency gains. The framework's near-linear scalability and 45% cost reduction demonstrate its superiority over monolithic architectures that often bottleneck under expanding AI workloads.

Breaking Down the Innovation

The modular AI architecture divides complex systems into standalone components, each handling specific tasks like vision or language processing. This separation enables teams to independently optimize and scale individual modules. Organizations report dramatic improvements: 40% better system performance and 75% faster development cycles through parallel workstreams and targeted enhancements of each component.

Revolutionizing Resource Management

One of the most significant breakthroughs is in resource utilization. The new architecture demonstrates a 30% improvement in resource efficiency, with CPU utilization increasing from 40% to 70% on average. This enhanced efficiency translates to substantial cost savings and reduced environmental impact, with energy efficiency improving by 25%.

Real-Time Processing Breakthrough

The system has achieved remarkable improvements in real-time processing capabilities. The architecture can handle a tenfold increase in request volume with only a minimal 20% increase in response time. This breakthrough enables AI applications to process millions of operations per second while maintaining consistent performance, a crucial capability for modern AI-driven services.

Security and Compliance Evolution

The framework incorporates advanced security measures that have shown impressive results. Implementation of modern authentication methods has reduced unauthorized access attempts by 60%, while new encryption protocols have virtually eliminated successful data breaches. These security improvements don't come at the cost of performance – the system maintains high availability with 99.99% uptime.

Transforming User Experience

The optimized architecture has transformed user interactions. With AI operations now executing 40% faster at 300ms versus the previous 500ms, users experience notably smoother interactions. The 15% boost in AI accuracy further elevates the experience, resulting in measurably higher satisfaction scores and more efficient task completion.

Future-Ready Innovation

The framework's dynamic adaptability revolutionizes cloud computing by intelligently responding to fluctuating workloads. Its sophisticated architecture seamlessly scales resources in real-time, effortlessly absorbing traffic surges while preventing resource waste during lulls. This precise elasticity optimizes cost efficiency and delivers unwavering performance, marking a breakthrough in cloud infrastructure management and operational excellence.

Business Impact and Efficiency

Organizations implementing this architecture have seen transformative results. Development velocity increased dramatically, with new feature deployment accelerated by 60% - shrinking timelines from months to weeks. Beyond the technical advantages, businesses achieved measurable gains in user engagement, with AI-enhanced features driving a significant 23% boost in conversion rates, delivering tangible bottom-line impact.

Sustainable Computing

The enhanced architectural design revolutionizes sustainable computing through intelligent resource management. By dynamically allocating computational resources and implementing advanced power-saving algorithms, the system achieves remarkable energy efficiency without compromising processing capabilities. The optimization reduces electricity consumption and cooling requirements, directly lowering carbon emissions. This innovation proves that cutting-edge performance can coexist with environmental stewardship, setting a new standard for eco-conscious computing solutions.

In conclusion, the innovative architectural framework developed by Vaibhav Vudayagiri marks a significant milestone in cloud computing advancement. His approach not only revolutionizes AI system scaling but also establishes a robust foundation for future cloud solutions. This breakthrough enables organizations to build more efficient and sustainable AI-driven systems, optimizing both operational costs and environmental impact while paving the way for next-generation computing capabilities.

body.title: What to Expect When Starting Out With Microsegmentation
body.description: If you’re building a zero trust architecture, microsegmentation should be a crucial part of your plan. Here are the 10 things ...
body.article_content:
Originally published by Illumio.

Written by Christer Swartz, Solutions Marketing Director, Illumio.





According to Gartner, “By 2026, 60% of enterprises working toward zero trust architecture will use more than one deployment form of microsegmentation, which is up from less than 5% in 2023.”

Microsegmentation is foundational to zero trust. You can’t achieve zero trust without it.

In fact, John Kindervag, the creator of Zero Trust, addressed the connection between zero trust and segmentation in the second report ever written on the topic, Build Security Into Your Network’s DNA: The Zero Trust Network Architecture. In the report, he said, “New ways of segmenting networks must be created because all future networks need to be segmented by default.”

If you’re building a zero trust architecture, microsegmentation should be a crucial part of your plan. Here are the 10 things you can expect to do when starting out with microsegmentation.‍





1. Get visibility into all workload traffic across every environment

The first — and one of the most important — steps of building microsegmentation is being able to know what’s going on across all segments in your network. How do you see all traffic between all workloads across your cloud, endpoint, and data center environments? It’s crucial to be able to achieve this level of visibility at any scale without an overly complex workflow.

You can try to use different visibility tools for different segments across your network. But using multiple tools will create a fragmented view. This can make it challenging to understand behavior across all segments everywhere.

Instead, find a solution that can discover traffic across all segments and display it in one view.





‍2. Understand how apps are communicating

Most people agree that Zero Trust is a good idea, but how can you understand what traffic is required before deciding what to protect? It’s not always easy to see what apps are running across your network and what ports they need to use.

With the right solution, you can discover what applications are running on all workloads and what ports they’re using. This provides a comprehensive inventory of all applications and their dependencies in your network so you can decide how to enforce segmentation policy.

‍

3. Lock down your most critical, highest-risk resources

Not all entry points into your network are under your direct control. While a data center for a campus network might have strong controls in place, resources in the cloud or partners’ third-party access are often less secure.

Many threats start from these less-secure environments because they’re often left open due to human error. Any of these access points can be an attacker’s first step in the door, allowing threats to move across your network to your high-value assets.





The dotted lines represent open ports between environments which allow malware to spread through the network.

That’s where a microsegmentation solution can help you secure these vulnerable parts of your network. No matter where a breach happens, microsegmentation will block it from reaching critical resources that you’ve segmented. The breach will be isolated to the other side of that segment so it can’t cause further damage. ‍





4. Label workloads by business functions, not network addresses

In today’s modern networks, workloads are deployed across a hybrid, multi-cloud architecture. This makes network addresses ephemeral. A workload’s network address can change dynamically depending on the underlying hosting environment.

That’s why you should label workloads using human-readable labels rather than traditional IP addresses. With a microsegmentation solution, you can identify workloads by their business function or ownership — such as their role, application, environment, location, operating system, or business unit — which is a lot more informative their using an IP address.

By using human-readable labels, you get a metadata-driven solution for seeing how segments between workloads are enforced that is fully decoupled from network address. ‍





5. Decide on an agent and agentless approach

When building microsegmentation, it's important to understand when an agent or agentless approach works best. Some solutions give you a choice between using agents or not so that you can get visibility and segmentation across all workloads in every environment.

Agent approach

Collects telemetry about application use on and between workloads. This allows you to control access to segments directly at the workload.

Agentless approach

Discovers and enforces the use of segments without an agent.

This is crucial in environments that can’t support agents, like IoT devices in the manufacturing or healthcare industries. It’s also key in environments that can’t use agents because of compliance requirements.





‍6. Start with a denylist model, then move to an allowlist model

A common challenge teams run into when building microsegmentation is that they know the ports they want to deny, but they don’t fully understand all the ports they need to allow for applications.

Ransomware commonly uses ports such as Remote Desktop Protocol (RDP) and Server Message Block (SMB) to move across segments between workloads. But we know that these ports rarely need to be open between workloads.

That’s why it’s best practice to start with a denylist model. Block only the ports you know shouldn’t be open and allow all others. Then, when you have a full understanding of what ports applications need, you can switch to an allowlist model. Keep only the required ports open and block all others.

This approach allows you to begin building microsegmentation by ransomware today and tightening policy when you’re ready.

‍

7. Model policy before it’s deployed

Cybersecurity has long relied on a deploy-and-pray approach. Security teams create a policy model and modify it until it looks correct. Then, when it’s deployed, they pray the phone doesn’t ring from broken application dependencies.

That’s why it’s best to test your policy before it's fully deployed. Modeling ensures your policy can be deployed safely without the risk of inadvertently breaking application dependencies.





8. Extend consistent segmentation across the hybrid multi-cloud

If you use a solution that can only build segmentation in the data center, then you’re unlikely to get consistent security in other environments like the cloud. Segmentation should never be dependent on a single environment. This will result in a siloed approach to segmentation which will only leave vulnerabilities and make it harder to stop and contain breaches.

Instead, microsegmentation needs to follow the workload as it migrates across environments. This ensures that segmentation doesn’t break as workloads are hosting in different environments.





‍9. Automate security changes without relying on human decisions

Malware spreads faster than any human can type on a keyboard. It’s crucial to have a microsegmentation solution that can automate policy changes as fast as a breach can spread.

‍

10. Prove security is in compliance

Quantifying risk can be challenging, since securing applications and segments can involve many moving parts. During an audit, it’s not always easy to get a clear picture of existing risk and how it’s lowered after security policy is applied. It’s important to use tools that show this before and after comparison.





About the Author

Christer Swartz is Solutions Marketing Director at Illumio. He has spent many years in the Networking industry, beginning with a small startup called Cisco. He was previously with Netflix, designing the birth of their Internet video-streaming architecture, and also with Palo Alto Networks, designing deep security in both data center and cloud architectures.

body.title: Father broke down with rage when reunited with adopted 'child' accused of being an adult
body.description: The father who adopted Natalia Grace, the Ukrainian orphan who allegedly made several attempts to kill him and his wife, ...
body.article_content:
The father who adopted Natalia Grace, the Ukrainian orphan who allegedly made several attempts to kill him and his wife, broke down during an awkward confrontation that saw the pair reunite.

Viewers were stunned when docuseries The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: Natalia Speaks dropped in 2023, detailing Natalia - who has a rare form of dwarfism - and her adoption story.

Husband and wife Kristine and Michael Barnett took in who they believed to be a six-year-old into their Indiana home in 2010. Then years after she was accused of being a 22-year-old, Michael sat down with Natalia to have a very awkward conversation. Watch below:

Just months after Natalia was adopted, the Barnett family claimed she was an 'adult sociopath masquerading as a child' who allegedly tried to kill them.

Advert

"She tried to poison and kill my wife," Michael claimed, "One night, I opened my eyes and Natalia is standing at the foot of the bed with a knife in her hand."

Natalia has continuously denied all of the allegations made against her. In 2024 documentary Natalia Speaks, health testing company TruDiagnostic estimated that she was then about 22 years old, meaning she was between six and nine years old when she was adopted by the Barnetts.

In a clip which was released by Investigation Discovery last year, Natalia is seen reuniting with Michael and asking him: "Why are we here?"

"Why are we here?" responded Michael, "If you're talking philosophically."

Advert

The confrontation between Natalia Grace and her former adoptive father was very awkward (Investigation Discovery)

"No, I want to know, why did you adopt me in the first place?" she then asked.

"Many of these questions there's not going to be a single answer to," he told her, whilst alleging he was manipulated and mistreated by Kristine, his now ex-wife.

In the documentary, Natalia alleges that she was abused by Kristine, claiming that she pepper-sprayed her multiple times and hit her with a belt.

Advert

Kristine has denied the accusations from both Natalia and Michael.

"What do you mean by you were a victim?" Natalia asked, to which Michael replied: "This is not easy. I had the same monster you did."

"I was exceptionally controlled and put down and threatened, was minimalised, anything that was who I was was ripped from me and I was guided and instructed to be exactly what she wanted me to be," he went on.

He stormed off set (Investigation Discovery)

Advert

Michael seemed to be getting nowhere with his former adopted daughter and stormed out of the interview following a confrontation with people behind the camera.

"I tried, I tried," he repeated as he walked off set.

Having made headlines a couple of years ago, Natalia has provided a fresh update in season three of her docuseries, titled The Curious Case of Natalia Grace: The Final Chapter.

Natalia has now settled in with Nicole DePaul, 49, and her husband Vince, 51 - who also have dwarfism - in upstate New York. The couple tried to adopt her in 2009, but were turned down.

body.title: People vow to never eat crispy bacon again after seeing it's made with 'liquid smoke'
body.description: People have lost their appetites for bacon after finding out how the breakfast favourite is made in meat factories, ...
body.article_content:
Getting a glimpse of what goes down in a meat factory will likely make or break your relationship with bacon.

Although you might satisfy your curiosity, you might also leave yourself feeling quite sick when you shatter the illusion - so, keep reading at your own risk.

Humans are pretty obsessed with finding out how our favourite foods are made, whether that be iconic crisps like Quavers, crab sticks, or meal deal sandwiches.

Advert

This could make or break your relationship with bacon (Getty Stock Image)

But once you gain that knowledge, there is no going back - and news flash, food processing factories aren't the most appetising places, ironically.

A lot of people who watched Discovery UK's 'How It's Made' clip explaining where bacon comes from said they have been put off the stuff for good.

The footage, which was uploaded to YouTube in 2018, takes viewers behind-the-scenes in a meat factory to show what steps it takes to get pre-cooked bacon on supermarket shelves.

Advert

Essentially, a load of pork bellies are put inside of a big tumbler which tosses them around repeatedly, as this softens the slabs of meat and makes it easier to remove the skin.

Each of these pork bellies are then placed skin-side down on a conveyor belt, which takes them on a journey towards a 'long automated blade' that slices the skin off.

People have been left stunned after finding out how bacon is made (YouTube/Discovery UK)

But don't worry, this stuff doesn't go to waste, as they will be used to be processed into pork rinds.

Advert

Meanwhile, the good stuff is sent along another conveyor belt and towards a flipping device which puts them back-side down, so any excess skin can be hand-removed by staff.

From there, the pork is cured in a brine solution before the flavourings are added, the video explained.

Salt is funnelled into a tank of water and mixed thoroughly until it dissolves, before liquid smoke and other tastes are added - and the bellies are then 'repeatedly injected' with this curing concoction.

Metal hangers are pressed into each individual pork belly so they can be hung on a rack and can then head to the 'drench cabinet'... which is where things get a bit weird.

Advert

The meat is treated to a 'shower of liquid smoke', in scenes which resemble some kind of horror movie bloodbath, which adds flavour and colour to the porks surface.

The 'shower of liquid smoke' left viewers stunned (YouTube/Discovery UK)

These are then cooked for five hours at a low temperature, before being put into a blast freezer to cool them down.

From there, they head to another cooler for a few days, which makes the meat 'easier to slice' for when they head to the sizing station to get a quick trim.

Advert

"They also pass under a metal detector to confirm that no piece from the metal hanger has gotten lodged in the meat," the video explained.

Finally, the pork bellies are put into chutes which sway back and forth over a blade, creating those iconic bacon pieces we all know and love.

They then tumble onto another conveyor belt to get blasted in a browning microwave, before being packaged and ferried off to supermarkets.

It's a wild ride, that's for sure - and a lot of people were left with a bad taste in their mouths after finding out the truth about bacon, in particular the 'liquid smoke' element.

One social media user said: "'Liquid smoke and other flavouring', yeah...that’s not going in my body again."

Another wrote: "This the last time I look up how something is made."

A third added: "You absolutely know none of these workers eat bacon anymore," while a fourth typed: "People say bacon taste 'good' yet its just the seasonings."

A social media user also explained what 'liquid smoke' is actually 'exactly what it says on the tin, commenting: "burn wood, run the smoke through a condensing column, and then capture the resulting liquid."

However, other viewers were left with an uncontrollable hankering for bacon after watching the clip, saying nothing could put them off the stuff.

One chimed in: "This hasn't reduced my love for bacon in any way, I just think about how much work it takes."

And a second joked: "Came here expecting to be put off bacon for life, left wanting bacon."

So, will you still bring home the bacon, or will you be giving it a miss from now on?

body.title: Joe Rogan’s JRE surpassed by massive show as Spotify’s top podcast
body.description: Joe Rogan’s JRE podcast was just dethroned on Spotify by a health and wellness host for the most popular show.
body.article_content:
Joe Rogan’s JRE podcast was just dethroned on Spotify as the most popular show on the platform by an unexpected creator.

Time and again, Joe Rogan’s ‘JRE’ podcast has been a number-one hit on Spotify. His discussions about controversial topics and conspiracy theories have captured the likes of millions since he debuted JRE in 2009 on Ustream.

Rogan’s fanbase skyrocketed even more after Spotify purchased the rights to air JRE in May 2020.

With so much competition in the podcast realm, like Theo Von’s ‘This Past Weekend’ and Alex Cooper’s ‘Call Her Daddy,’ JRE has had to produce mind-bending discussions to keep listeners tuned in — which he’s done seamlessly.

Article continues after ad

Instagram: joerogan Joe Rogan pictured with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerburg.

From his theories on an alien invasion to flying dragons, Rogan’s topics have enthralled his fans, making JRE stay at the top of Spotify’s rankings for the most-listened-to podcast.

However, Rogan’s podcast has seen an occasional drop on Spotify’s The Podcast Charts, giving way for other hosts to reign victorious — which is exactly what just happened.

Article continues after ad

JRE dethroned by The Mel Robbins Podcast on Spotify

At the time of writing, JRE has been surpassed as Spotify’s number-one podcast in the US by The Mel Robbins Podcast.

Article continues after ad

Mel Robbins is a New York Times bestselling author and a motivational speaker. On her podcast, she discusses how to cultivate positivity for your well-being as well as health tips and facts.

“You can change your life and Mel Robbins will show you how,” her podcast bio reads. “Every episode is packed with deeply relatable topics, tactical advice, hilarious screwups, compelling conversations, and the tools and inspiration you need to create a better life.”

Rogan previously saw a drop in his JRE stats in December 2024 when Kylie Kelce’s ‘Not Gonna Lie’ debuted. In the same month, ‘The Telepathy Tapes’ podcast also toppled JRE as the most popular show.

Article continues after ad

While JRE might currently be number two on Spotify’s charts, the rankings tend to change quickly, resulting in Rogan’s podcast likely being number one, once more, in little to no time.
